## Public Member Functions

### convertInitializerBitRange() {#a269320a25f13a22f2aebeb9136063a91}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; IntInit::convertInitializerBitRange (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; Bits) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This function is used to implement the bit range selection operator.

Given a value, it selects the specified bits, returning them as a new <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/init">Init</a></code> of type <code>bits</code>. If it is not legal to use the bit selection operator on this value, null is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00661">661</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l00635">635</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### convertInitializerTo() {#ae0acbf48b19610c4bcfecabba532c4a9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Init &#42; IntInit::convertInitializerTo (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recty">RecTy</a> &#42; Ty) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Convert to a value whose type is <code>Ty</code>, or return null if this is not possible.

This can happen if the value&#39;s type is convertible to <code>Ty</code>, but there are unresolved references.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00659">659</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp/#l00608">608</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/tablegen/record-cpp">Record.cpp</a>.

### isConcrete() {#ac666849d4d5b0aa574f8d7a9c1372154}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::IntInit::isConcrete () const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Is this a concrete and fully resolved value without any references or stuck operations?

Unset values are concrete.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h/#l00663">663</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/tablegen/record-h">Record.h</a>.
